comments:
Drop and size a Shell on an empty file. Set its layout to GridLayout. Now just
drop a Button on the Shell. From the property sheet of the Button, expand the
'layoutData' property and set the property 'grabExcessHorizontalSpace' and
'grabExcessVerticalSpace' to be true - this will cause the button to grab all
available space of the Shell. Now select a Composite from the palette and
proceed to the Java Beans view. If you hover over the Shell in the Java Beans
view, the following exceptions are thrown in the log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 May 27, 2004 11:57:56.358

!STACK 0

I fixed this the other day... the GridLayout helper class was returning null
instead of an empty list when getting the default contraints:
      helper.getDefaultConstraint

Should be in the next integration/stable build on 6/10/04
1.0M2 is out, so these are now closed in M2.
